University of Messina: The University of Messina (Italian: Universit√† degli Studi di Messina; Latin: Studiorum Universitas Messanae), known colloquially as UniME, is a state university located in Messina, Sicily, Italy. Founded in 1548 by Pope Paul III, it was the world's first Jesuit college,[1] and today it is counted among the oldest universities in Italy.
